name: unstained
content:
unstained adjective
(MARK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
without any dirty marks: The mug was unstained. He found an unstained cloth.
not having had the colour changed by a chemical being added: The larvae were studied using both stained and unstained specimens. Viable cells remained unstained.
More examplesFewer examplesHer shirt was neat and unstained.

Colour - general words
unstained adjective
(CHARACTER)
If someone has an unstained reputation, it has not been spoiled or damaged, and people's opinion of the person continues to be good: The previous chairman left with an unstained reputation. He emerged largely unstained by the scandal, but promised to improve his firm's procedures. Synonym
untarnished (REPUTATION)
not influenced by something bad, and remaining morally good: He remained unstained and unsullied in an evil world. Their grandfather kept his convictions unstained by politics. Synonym
pure (MORALLY GOOD)
More examplesFewer examplesThe defendant's previously unstained reputation was not mentioned. He hoped to keep his son unstained by his father's crime.
